sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Shinkin's misfortune: or, The poor Welsh taylor kidnapt [sic] for stealing a goose, leek and a cock-gelding. To a tune of Teague and Sawney: or, Lilliburlero. Liscensed according to order.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill.
Printed for J. Deacon at the Angel in Gilt-Spur-Street, [London] : [between 1688 and 1690]
Place and date range of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). In verse. First line: Shinkin ap shone was rob a creet house. Printed in black letter in three columns. Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland--Crawford Collections.
=======
